xwikidoc.title: IRC Archive for channel #phenotips on 19 May 2013
xwikidoc.content: <ravigarg27> has quit 09:22 <ravigarg27> has quit 09:47 <BogdanVancea> has quit 14:37 <ravigarg27> has quit 14:51 <tishan> has joined #phenotips 15:11 <tishan> sdumitriu1: Hi 15:22 <sdumitriu> Hi 15:23 <sdumitriu> tishan: How are you? 15:24 <tishan> I was working on the task you gave me 15:24 <tishan> still could not build because of the issue i told you earlier 15:24 <tishan> :( 15:24 <tishan> even tried with ADSL 15:24 <tishan> no luck 15:24 <sdumitriu> Ah, fails to download the xwiki war? 15:25 <tishan> nope this one 15:25 <tishan> lucene-analyzers-common-4.0.0.jar 15:26 <sdumitriu> http://nexus.cs.toronto.edu/nexus/content/groups/public/org/apache/lucene/lucene-analyzers-common/4.0.0/lucene-analyzers-common-4.0.0.jar ? 15:26 <tishan> yup 15:26 <sdumitriu> Hm... 15:27 <tishan> it should be a connection error 15:28 <tishan> download stops exactly at 458KB 15:30 <sdumitriu> How about this one? http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/apache/lucene/lucene-analyzers-common/4.0.0/lucene-analyzers-common-4.0.0.jar 15:31 <tishan> tried 15:31 <sdumitriu> K, let me try something else 15:31 <tishan> it also halts 15:32 <tishan> I tried various thing for about a day 15:32 <tishan> :) 15:34 <sdumitriu> Try this file: http://phenotips.org/skins/lucene-analyzers-common-4.0.0.jar.bz2.gz 15:36 <tishan> done :0 15:36 <tishan> :) 15:37 <sdumitriu> Good 15:37 <sdumitriu> It's bzipped then gzipped 15:37 <sdumitriu> So undo that in reverse order 15:37 <tishan> ok.got the jar 15:38 <sdumitriu> Now move it in ~/.m2/repository/org/apache/lucene/lucene-analyzers-common/4.0.0 15:38 <sdumitriu> Try to build, see if it works 15:38 <tishan> shouldnt we update m2 registry 15:38 <sdumitriu> No 15:39 <sdumitriu> I guess the problem was a content filter, probably an antivirus scanner that was falsely triggered by the jar 15:40 <tishan> um using ubuntu 12.04 15:40 <sdumitriu> Yeah, probably not from your machine, somewhere along the line 15:41 <sdumitriu> Although it's strange that it happened on multiple connections 15:41 <tishan> hmm.. 15:44 <sdumitriu> Building? 15:44 <tishan> yup. still building 15:46 <tishan> in SL we get internet connections for amount data. like 5GB per month. not bandwidth wise. 15:47 <tishan> this month my connection has exceeded the limit.:) 15:47 <sdumitriu> Oh 15:48 <tishan> it takes a while to build 15:49 <tishan> mobile broadband connections are around 1Mbps 15:52 <tishan> In the meantime can you give a brief overview of the problem. What I understood is use existing create record ui and save the record with predefined version message 15:53 <tishan> then design a new ui to list down new visits and fetch visits using the version message 15:53 <sdumitriu> Yes 15:54 <tishan> since records are saved as wikis I need to study some xwiki 15:54 <tishan> snt t? 15:54 <sdumitriu> In PhenoTips the version message is hidden 15:54 <sdumitriu> So you can do two things to specify one 15:54 <sdumitriu> 1. Use an URL that contains the message 15:55 <sdumitriu> 2. Write a script that calls $doc.save('message') 15:57 <sdumitriu> To list versions from the history, you can look at what webapps/phenotips/templates/historyinline.vm does 15:57 <tishan> for 1. message should be included here. def createURL = newDoc.getURL() snt t 15:57 <tishan> isnt it? 15:58 <sdumitriu> Yes 15:58 <sdumitriu> The name of the request parameter is "comment" 15:59 <sdumitriu> So append comment=something in the URL 16:01 <tishan> ok 16:02 <tishan> seems like some xwiki knowledge is needed 16:04 <sdumitriu> Yes 16:07 <tishan> is this used for retrieving def crtMaxIDList = crtContext.getWiki().search()? 16:08 <sdumitriu> Retrieving what? 16:09 <tishan> patient recordings 16:09 <tishan> i mean new records 16:09 <sdumitriu> Well, search is the method that searches stuff in the database 16:09 <sdumitriu> It can only retrieve existing data 16:10 <sdumitriu> There's no explicit method for creating documents 16:10 <sdumitriu> They get created when they're saved 16:10 <sdumitriu> How's your schedule, do you still have school/exams? 16:11 <tishan> yeah. have a presentation on tuesday 16:11 <tishan> was busy on completing it last week 16:11 <sdumitriu> Oh, so you're not really free to work on this 16:13 <tishan> not really. I can manage around 6-8 hours tommorw 16:14 <tishan> I only started out yesterday. Did not thought this would take much time 16:15 <sdumitriu> Yes, I might have underestimated the complexity, given that you don't really know that much about the platform 16:15 <sdumitriu> But I'm here to help 16:16 <tishan> thanks :) 16:17 <tishan> better to have a all nighter tomorrow. working in day time isnt much effective since u are unavailable due to time zone issue 16:17 <sdumitriu> Well, I should be up pretty early 16:17 <sdumitriu> Today I got up at 4:15 16:17 <sdumitriu> Not sure I can do that again tomorrow 16:18 <tishan> u are GMT-?? 16:18 <sdumitriu> 4 16:20 <tishan> Then ill start around 4 pm 16:20 <sdumitriu> K 16:20 <tishan> I can work till 2-3 am 16:20 <tishan> used to it :) 16:21 <tishan> it is already 2 am 16:27 <tishan> g2g sdumitriu. catch u tommorow. have a nice day 16:28 <sdumitriu> Good night 16:33 <tishan> has quit 16:47 <krinye> has quit
